# The new stone furnaces have been successfully placed, but they currently have no fuel or ingredients to smelt. 
# The original furnace has produced 1 iron plate but is also lacking ingredients.

# To optimize production, we need to ensure all furnaces have both coal for fuel and iron ore for smelting. 
# We have 15 coal in our inventory, so we can distribute that among the furnaces.

# Let's insert coal into all furnaces first. We will allocate 4 coal to each of the 4 furnaces.
for furnace in get_entities(Furnace):
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=4)

# Next, we need to ensure that we have enough iron ore to keep the furnaces running. 
# We will need to gather more iron ore from the nearest iron ore patch.
iron_ore_position = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_ore_position)

# Harvesting more iron ore, let's gather 20 iron ore this time.
harvested_iron_ore = harvest_resource(iron_ore_position, quantity=20)  # Harvest 20 iron ore.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}") 

# After gathering iron ore, we will insert it into the furnaces to begin smelting. 
for furnace in get_entities(Furnace):
    insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 iron ore into each furnace.

# Finally, check the status of the furnaces and our inventory again.
print(f"Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
